channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti, 29th June
item.description:
Old Kent zRoad. Remove graffiti from Bus shelter closest to Ilderton Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 29th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked on Maberley Rd opposite my flat (22d) since the beginning of January 2025, so almost 6 months. It has not moved at all and is very dusty. Road tax and MOT are both valid, but it seems odd that it hasn't moved for 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A family dismantled their shed and left it dumped with nails and wooden part near a childs swing, 29th June
item.description:
Very dangerous number 18 Emberton190 Albany road se5 left garden waste wooden broken fence...a broken garden shed next to a child's swing. It's. Very dangerous and a eye saw. The whole.estate watched them dump It there with no care in the world

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on Elmers End Rd, 29th June
item.description:
A car looks abandoned on Elmers End Road, pretty much opposite the turning into Ancaster Rd. The left front and rear tyres are punctured and the car has not moved in a few months. It's MOT has also expired, but the road tax is still valid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oaks in Cator Park, 29th June
item.description:
Given the tragic events of the weekend where a tree in Essex collapsed due to the recent hot, dry weather I think it would be prudent to review the oaks in Cator Park, especially near the play area. Oaks can easily shed boughs to protect themselves in hot dry conditions and there have been at least 2 unforeseen incidents in the last few years where they did exactly this. Luckily these incidents didnâ€™t result in injury or loss of life. Could you please arrange for all trees in the park to be surveyed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bower Place, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken branch from large tree falling, 29th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Broad Oaks Way, Park Langley, London
